By Gracie Daw

The campaign has over 500 signatures from students and demands that the University of York end their contract with Circuit Laundry

By James Clay

By James Clay

By James Clay

University announces death of Long Boi

By Gracie Daw

The University released a statement on the Radio 1 Breakfast show saying they were "forced to conclude he has passed away"

York students achieve national success with one-take videos

Two one-take, one minute videos produced and filmed by York students have become a national success this week after achieving over a million hits in the first month on YouTube, and appearing on both ITV Calendar and GMTV

York students urged to help in the search for missing chef

Thousands of students are being urged to help in the search for missing chef, Claudia Lawrence, who disappeared last Wednesday.

Police search for any information regarding missing chef

Claudia Lawrence, 35, has now been missing for eight days. She was last seen by colleagues at Goodricke College last Wednesday. She has not been in touch with family or friends since 8.30pm that evening

Further concerns for missing Goodricke chef

Police investigating the disappearance of a 35 year-old chef at Goodricke College have confirmed fears that she "may have come to some harm."

Goodricke chef missing

Claudia Elizabeth Lawrence, a chef at Goodricke College, has been missing for five days. Detectives have not ruled out the possibility that she has been abducted.

Funeral details for Dr Ron Weir announced

The funeral of Dr Ron Weir, Derwent Provost and Senior Lecturer in Economic History, will take place on Friday the 27th of March at midday

Summer ball to stay off campus after EGM motion fails

The results of the vote following yesterday's EGM motion reveal that the summer ball will not be moved to campus this year

Voting opens following EGM

Today's EGM saw speeches from both sides of the ongoing debate about where to hold the Graduation Dinner and Summer Ball. <em>Nouse</em> and YSTV were on scene to capture the highlights.

Campus' response to EGM announcement

As discontent grows about the decision to move the Summer Ball to campus from its traditional Racecourse venue, YSTV and <em>Nouse</em> interview those petitioning against the move decided in Union Council yesterday.

EGM on Summer Ball location to take place tomorrow

YUSU have confirmed that an Emergency General Meeting to decide the future of the Summer Ball will go ahead.

EGM 'very likely' after student outrage over Summer Ball relocation decision

An anonymous YUSU source has suggested an Emergency General Meeting (EGM) to overturn the Summer Ball relocation decision is 'very likely'.

Tim Ngwena wins 2009/10 YUSU Presidency - How it happened

By James Bithell

Live coverage of YUSU Elections 2009 from <em>Nouse</em>

Ron Weir, Derwent Provost, passes away

It has been announced today that Derwent Provost Ron Weir died of a heart attack last night.

Exit Polls predict narrow win for Langrish in race for President

Exit polls have predicted a slim 4 point victory for Tom Langrish over presidential rival Tim Ngwena.

Eight motions passed after UGM

Eight out of nine of the UGM proposals put forward at Week 8's UGM meeting have been passed

York ranked fifth worldwide for post-doctoral research

The University of York has been ranked fifth on a list of the 'Top International Institutions for Post-doctorate scientific research' by American magazine <em>The Scientist</em>.

Controversial Gaza UGM Motion narrowly passes despite 'sensationalist' Vote No Campaign

The UGM motion 'End the Humanitarian Crisis in Gaza' has been narrowly passed this afternoon by 245 votes to 216.

YUSU: Just another popularity contest?

Our cross-campus panel of experts discuss matters of student politics, elections, and how YUSU needs to improve.

Visa fee rises to damage overseas recruitment

A government decision to raise visa fees for international students will potentially endanger the economic viability of York's PS500 million expansion project.

York duo's 'fun little project' grabs national attention

Two second-year Computer Science students, David Somers and Tom Brearley, have achieved national recognition for their internet application 'Twitterfall'.

Protests spark counter campaign on campus

The signatures on the DISARM petition handed into Heslington Hall by the protest two weeks ago were "gathered on false grounds", allege the founders of the anti-protest facebook group.

York elite status confirmed as research funding increases

The University's national reputation for research excellence was recognised and made financially secure last week.

Poll shows lead for Ngwena in Presidential race with large proportion still undecided

Tim Ngwena leads the race for YUSU President according to a Nouse poll conducted last week.

University passes ethical investment policy following student campaign

The University of York has begun the implementation of an ethical investment policy following years of student pressure.

Forty-eight candidates registered to stand in Union elections

This years YUSU elections sees 48 candidates competing for the 23 positions available.

Nine motions raised at UGM

A total of nine motions were submitted at the UGM on Thursday March 5, including the proposal to 'tidy-up' the constitution and improve private lettings in York.

Record numbers attend York's biggest charity event 'World Fusion'

Last week York played host to Fusion, the University's hugely popular fashion and dance show.

Beer prices rise as brewery costs go up

York pubs have announced a likely 10p increase to the cost of a pint.

YUSU consider move to Langwith

YUSU are now considering moving the student centre to Langwith, rather than the new campus on Heslington East.

'Viking Kath' drops out of race for Sports President

Kath Mildon has withdrawn from the YUSU elections for York Sport President and NUS Conference Delegate, citing incompatibility with existing work commitments. (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Justyn Harcastle)
